snippet: Stockton, Calif., recently became the largest city in the country to declare bankruptcy, but evidence of its problems has been mounting for years.
abstract: Stockton, Calif, has become the largest city in the country to declare bankruptcy, but evidence of its problems has been mounting for years; decline was visible in the rising domestic violence rates and stream of foreclosures in the city of 292,000 residents; while Stockton's bankruptcy troubles can be traced in part to the housing market collapse and erosion of the city's tax base, for years city leaders also mismanaged and overspent funds.
lead_paragraph: Stockton, Calif., recently became the largest city in the country to declare bankruptcy, but evidence of its problems has been mounting for years.

headline.seo: In Stockton, Calif., Years of Unraveling, Then Bankruptcy
headline.main: Years of Unraveling, Then Bankruptcy for a City
headline.print_headline: Years of Unraveling, Then Bankruptcy for a City
